description: Classical swine fever virus (CSFV) is the pathogen of Classical swine fever (CSF). CSFV belongs to the genus of pestiviruses of the family of Flaviviridae. Other members of this genus are bovine viral diarrhoea virus (BVDV) and the ovine Border disease virus (BDV). Pestiviruses are spherical (40-60 nm) and enveloped. The genome is a singlestranded RNA of positive polarity and contained within the capsid and is approximately 12.5 kilobases long.
name: Classical Swine Gever Virus Antibodies and Antigens
